title: Ecumenism
summary: Ecumenism (/ɪˈkjuːmənɪzəm/), also spelled oecumenism,  is the concept and principle in which Christians who belong to different Christian denominations work together to develop closer relationships among their churches and promote Christian unity.[2] The adjective ecumenical is thus applied to any interdenominational initiative that encourages greater cooperation between Christians and their churches.
